aboutPage.title: ProFineArt Studio Basel: Contemporary Fine Art Pedagogy
aboutPage.intro: ProFineArt Studio Basel is the private educational project and professional practice of Ilya Medvedev, a contemporary fine artist and certified senior educator. As the sole creator, owner, and instructor, Ilya Medvedev manages every aspect of the project, providing specialized mentorship that combines historical tradition with contemporary artistic standards. All communication and instruction are conducted in English.
aboutPage.mobileText: ProFineArt Studio Basel operates as a mobile educational project rather than a physical school. There is no public studio or atelier for students to visit. This structure is designed to provide high-level fine art education within the student‚Äôs own environment. Ilya Medvedev travels directly to the student's private home or personal studio space to conduct every session. This ensures that the learning process is integrated into the student‚Äôs personal creative setting.
aboutPage.backgroundText: The curriculum is built upon a foundation of significant academic achievement and international experience. Ilya Medvedev holds a Bachelor of Education in Fine Arts (B.Ed.FA) and an Art Teaching Certification from the Hamidrasha Faculty of the Arts, as well as Master of Fine Arts studies from the Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design. With a career as a freelance artist spanning over 15 years, Ilya Medvedev brings a wealth of museum-level experience to the teaching process. This includes seven years of intensive study in Byzantine Icon Painting in Greece and Jerusalem, providing a rare technical depth in ancient media such as Byzantine Iconography and Egg Tempera.
aboutPage.methodologyText: The education provided focuses on mastering the visual language of fine art across several disciplines. The Byzantine Iconography course explores the sacred techniques of the old masters, focusing on historical accuracy and the mastery of light. The Oil Painting and Aquarelle programs emphasize the chemistry of materials, archival integrity, and the transition from classical underpainting to modern textures. In Academic Drawing, the focus is on developing a freehand 'eye-brain-hand' connection without the use of stencils or projectors. Other specialized courses include Mixed Media, Contemporary Painting, and Stone Painting, each designed to help the student navigate the complexities of form, color, and conceptual expression.

800.title: Byzantine Iconography Course
800.briefDescription: Unlock the ancient secrets of sacred painting through exclusive, live individual sessions with a focus on historical techniques and mastery of Egg Tempera.
800.description:
The Program Focus

This unique program offers exclusive individual sessions in person, dedicated to mastering the technical skills, historical, and spiritual depth of Byzantine iconography.

Questions You Will Answer

Secrets of the Masters

What are the secrets known only to professional icon painters and experienced restorers? We explore the composition of iconography and how the shimmering, vibrant colors are created.

Flawless Glazing Technique

How is the complex technique of Egg Tempera Glazing flawlessly executed?

Mastery of Line and Form

How to create perfect lines with a single brush stroke and draw an ideal circle with a brush? How is the volume of drapery and the mass of folds created in the clothing of iconographic figures?

The Art of Faces and Gilding

How are the faces of the saints painted so they appear to come alive in dim light and by candlelight? How to cover the icon with genuine gold leaf, and how to create fine folds and patterns with gold?

detailsSection.title: Program Content and Technical Mastery
detailsSection.text:
Foundational Freehand Drawing

The core of this program is the mastery of freehand drawing without stencils or projectors. You will learn to construct the human body from scratch: from the anatomy of hands and feet to diverse portraits of infants, adults, and the elderly including features like beards and baldness. We cover everything from the nude form to detailed clothing, footwear, and jewelry. This is the essential basis of the Byzantine program; mastering these fundamentals is required before transitioning to color painting to ensure the integrity of your artistic development.

Painting Techniques and Materials

You will master multi-layer glazing and underpainting techniques. You will thoroughly study pigments, water-based paints, and Egg Tempera. You will master the correct technique for working with brushes and the maulstick.

Schools and Traditions

You will explore various iconographic traditions: Proto-Byzantine technique, Fayum portraits and Roman Painting. Iconography Schools Roman, Cretan, Russian, Macedonian and Coptic.

Artistic and Philosophical Heritage

The iconography course is a deep immersion into ancient art and the techniques of old masters, offering a powerful foundation for any artist. Iconography is an art where every element such as color, gesture, and pose is a symbol conveying metaphysical meaning. You will learn to read and create this complex visual language, developing the ability for conceptual and narrative painting. Mastering iconographic drawing, symbolism, egg tempera glazing, and gilding provides a durable, high-quality technical base for creating works in both traditional and unique modern contexts.

Format and Logistics

The training is conducted as private individual sessions with the teacher traveling to the student's home for maximum comfort and efficiency. You choose your package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons and can repeat the purchase as needed. Note that all necessary materials and equipment are not included in the session cost. Lessons are conducted in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and bordering suburbs of Germany and France.

801.title: Oil Painting Course
801.briefDescription: Master the world‚Äôs most versatile and prestigious medium. From classical underpainting to modern textures, build a professional foundation in oil painting mastery.
801.description:
The Program Focus

Oil painting is the most prestigious and flexible technique in art history, from translucent watercolor-like washes to thick, massive impasto. This program is designed to simplify its complex variables, providing artists with a powerful foundation that even experienced painters often struggle to master.

Questions You Will Answer

The Fundamentals

Which components serve as the essential base for oil painting? Why does one painting glow with deep, vibrant colors while another appears dull and dry? How do you create light, shadow, and perfect color transitions?

Anatomy and Portraiture

How to paint the human body and create a portrait? What is the secret to rendering skin texture and lifelike tones? How do you create halftones and seamless transitions?

Tools and Materials

What is the purpose of coarse vs. soft brushes, and why are specific varnishes and thinners essential? Which pigments and oils are best for large-scale works, and which are required for small, detailed miniatures? Why choose between canvas, wood, or paper?

detailsSection.title: Program content and technical mastery
detailsSection.text:
Foundational Drawing and Composition

Traditional drawing is the heart of oil painting. Sometimes the drawing is created during the oil painting process. This requires a high level of mastery which we will cover during the course. You will learn to command form and proportion using various sources: photographs, old masters, or live studio setups. We may work on still life, live models, or 'en plein air' sessions to capture landscapes and figures under the open sky.

The Art of the Underpainting

You will master the technique of the initial sketch using charcoal, pastel, graphite, egg tempera, acrylic, or oil. This stage simplifies the entire painting process and can often stand alone as a finished work or serve as the vital structural map for your layers.

Canvas and Surface Preparation

You will learn the professional art of surface preparation: stretching canvases (linen, cotton, or synthetic) and understanding thread weight. We study the critical link between glues and gesso‚Äîincluding gypsum, acrylic, and oil-based primers‚Äîand how they directly influence the vibrancy, gloss, and archival quality of your work.

Advanced Application and Multi-Layering

We explore the spectrum from 'Alla Prima' to complex glazing (layering). You will learn to use specialized soft brushes for airy tones and fine details in portraits and drapery. We study the chemistry of oils‚Äîsuch as linseed and walnut‚Äîand which varieties are suited for hyper-realism versus large-scale works. You will also master the use of the maulstick and final varnishing to protect and highlight specific details.

Artistic and Philosophical Heritage

Mastering oil painting is an immersion into the primary language of fine art that has dominated the global market for centuries. In contemporary art, deep command of oils sets an artist apart, offering a level of material depth and prestige valued by galleries and collectors. This course provides the technical mastery to move between hyper-realism and expressive abstraction. By controlling every variable‚Äîfrom the hand-primed canvas to the final varnish‚Äîyou ensure your work possesses the archival integrity and visual power required for museum-level exhibitions and elite private commissions.

Format and Logistics

The training is conducted as private individual sessions with the teacher traveling to the student's home for maximum comfort and efficiency. You choose your package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons. Note that all necessary materials and equipment are not included in the session cost. Lessons are conducted in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and bordering suburbs of Germany and France.

802.title: Mixed Media Drawing Course
802.briefDescription: Master the versatile fusion of dry and wet media to create sophisticated illustrations and fine art, bridging the gap between classical drawing and modern painting.
802.description:
The Program Focus

This program develops a powerful artistic foundation by mastering the interaction of various materials, creating works that sit on the fine line between classical drawing and professional painting.

Questions You Will Answer

Layering and Logic

How do you effectively combine graphite and pastel with water-based paints? We explore the structural logic of layering‚Äîwhether following a classical sequence or a creative, spontaneous order.

Media Synergy

How can tools like airbrushes, markers, and dry pigments be used alongside traditional brushes to achieve depth and texture?

Mastery of Detail

How do you execute precise detailing using ink, pens, and fine brushes to bring a piece to its final, professional polish?

Historical and Modern Context

How did masters like D√ºrer and Da Vinci use these techniques? How are these methods applied today in digital industries and character design?

detailsSection.title: Program Content and Technical Mastery
detailsSection.text:
Advanced Material Science

You will gain comprehensive knowledge of pigments, alcohol-based markers, India ink, and various water-based media like tempera, aquarelle, gouache, and acrylic. You will learn to work on diverse surfaces including paper, cardboard, and wood, understanding how each substrate responds to different media.

Technique and Execution

The course covers everything from foundational graphite sketching to advanced finishing. You will master classical drawing techniques, the rendering of drapery, and specialized application methods using airbrushes or sponges to achieve unique atmospheric effects.

Professional Versatility

The skills gained here are highly sought after in modern industry, from children's book illustration and fashion design to architectural visualization. We also explore how these physical works are digitized for use in graphic design and the video game industry.

Artistic and Philosophical Heritage

Mastering mixed media allows an artist to break free from the constraints of a single medium. By mastering both dry and wet techniques, you build a versatile technical base that supports both monochrome realism and vibrant, multi-layered compositions. Whether you aim for gallery-level fine art or commercial illustration, this course provides the tools to produce works of professional depth and complexity.

Format and Logistics

The training is conducted as private individual sessions with the teacher traveling to the student's home for maximum comfort and efficiency. You choose your package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons. Note that all materials and equipment are not included. Lessons are conducted in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and bordering suburbs of Germany and France.

803.title: Aquarelle Course
803.briefDescription: Master the delicate balance of water and light. From precise photographic-based linear drawing to advanced glazing, develop professional skills in the sophisticated medium of Aquarelle.
803.description:
The Program Focus

Aquarelle is the art of controlling the elements of water and pigment. This program is designed to reveal the uniqueness of this specific medium: from understanding the physics of paper to creating sophisticated, large-scale works.

Questions You Will Answer

Secrets of Mastery

What is the true magic and uniqueness of Aquarelle? We will explore how to maintain color purity, avoid overworking the paper, and prevent unwanted surface damage.

Technical Excellence

How do you achieve a perfectly smooth wash without visible streaks? What is granulation, and how can you turn this effect into an artistic advantage?

Speed and Patience

How to work meticulously and calmly, given that Aquarelle requires patience? At the same time‚Äîhow do you learn to make instant decisions while the paint is still wet?

detailsSection.title: Program Content and Technical Mastery
detailsSection.text:
Foundational Drawing and Basics

A high-quality Aquarelle begins with a flawless graphite linear drawing. The primary priority of this program is mastering the transfer of a photographic prototype into a precise initial sketch. While working from photography is our first priority to ensure structural accuracy, we also learn to adapt these skills to live setups, including still lifes, models, and 'en plein air' sessions.

Material Science

You will study various paper types and understand how their quality directly impacts the final result. We will master methods for mounting paper on wooden boards and learn to use the board's tilt angle to achieve unique color effects.

Tools and Paint Chemistry

The program includes an in-depth study of Aquarelle paint types and mixing principles. You will learn to work with professional brushes‚Äîincluding those with French ferrules‚Äîand use auxiliary materials such as gum arabic and masking fluid.

Application Techniques

We will practice both wet-on-wet (alla prima) and wet-on-dry techniques, as well as multi-layer glazing, which allows for the creation of deep, transparent colors.

Artistic and Philosophical Heritage

Modern Aquarelle has evolved far beyond small-scale sketches. Mastering this art opens doors to prestigious contemporary art exhibitions and international festivals across Italy, the USA, France, and beyond. Today, these works reach impressive dimensions, captivating viewers with the grandeur of large-scale masterpieces and the precision of hyperrealism. Simultaneously, Aquarelle remains the ideal tool for abstraction and expression. This course provides a powerful technical foundation for professional illustration in books and magazines, as well as applications in fashion design.

Format and Logistics

The training is conducted as private individual sessions with the teacher traveling to the student's home for maximum comfort and efficiency. You choose your package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons. Note that all necessary materials and equipment are not included in the session cost. Lessons are conducted in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and bordering suburbs of Germany and France.

804.title: Academic Drawing Course
804.briefDescription: Master the language of line, light, and shadow. Build a powerful 'eye-brain-hand' connection through freehand techniques and classical anatomical study.
804.description:
The Program Focus

Graphics are the bedrock of all visual arts. While painting communicates through color and emotion, graphics speak the language of line, stroke, and contrast. This program focuses on developing the cognitive and physical mastery required to render the world with precision and character.

Questions You Will Answer

The Human Form

How do you accurately construct the human face and body? What are the secrets to achieving realistic proportions and capturing the essence of a subject?

Composition and Scale

Why do some drawings fail to fit the paper, and how do you master spatial planning? How do you measure objects with your eye to ensure perfect scale every time?

The Logic of Light

How is light and shadow created to give a flat surface three-dimensional volume? How do you manage transitions between sharp contrasts and soft gradients?

Overcoming the Blank Page

What should you do when a drawing feels 'stuck'? You will learn to view mistakes as part of the structural process, removing the fear of the white canvas.

detailsSection.title: Program Content and Technical Mastery
detailsSection.text:
The Power of the Freehand Stroke

In an era of projectors and AI, the art of the 'free hand' is becoming a rare and elite skill. This course rejects stencils in favor of developing a true biological 'handwriting.' You will learn to hold the hand correctly, creating effortless circles and fluid lines that form the skeleton of any great work. This process enhances spatial imagination and fine motor coordination, allowing for creative freedom that mechanical aids cannot provide.

Material Science and Specialized Media

You will gain a professional understanding of the interaction between media and substrate. We study diverse paper types tailored for graphite, charcoal, and pastel. The curriculum covers the taxonomy of graphite grades, professional methods for sharpening lead cores, and the correct use of various erasers, blending stumps (tortillions), and fixative varnishes. We also introduce the sophisticated 'Dry Brush' technique, bridging the gap between drawing and painting.

Anatomical Foundation and Texture

Anatomy is the most vital pillar of graphics. We focus on the realistic forms of the human body, providing the necessary base for any future work in color. You will master the 'stroke'‚Äîlearning to control line thickness and density. Beyond graphite, we explore the deep blacks of natural and compressed charcoal and the vibrant layering of soft and hard pastels to create professional-grade textures.

Artistic and Philosophical Heritage

Mastering freehand drawing is a profound cognitive exercise that builds a direct connection between perception and execution. Unlike tracing, which limits you to a single form, freehand drawing allows you to evolve the image as you work. This course transforms the student from a craftsman into an artist with a signature style, providing a technical foundation that is respected in both classical galleries and modern design industries.

Format and Logistics

The training is conducted as private individual sessions with the teacher traveling to the student's home for maximum comfort and efficiency. You choose your package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons. Note that all necessary materials and equipment are not included in the session cost. Lessons are conducted in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and bordering suburbs of Germany and France.

805.title: Stone Painting Course
805.briefDescription: Master the ancient and modern art of painting on stone. From prehistoric petroglyphs to contemporary fine art, learn to transform raw geological forms into eternal masterpieces.
805.description:
The Program Focus

Painting on stone is both one of the oldest and most contemporary forms of self-expression. Unlike a flat canvas, stone is a three-dimensional, eternal object that challenges the artist to work with its unique shape, weight, and geological history.

Questions You Will Answer

The Heritage of Stone

How did our ancestors use ochre and charcoal to create sacred petroglyphs in caves like Altamira? What are the secrets of the 16th-century masters, like Sebastiano del –ü—å–æ–º–±–æ, who used the natural veins of marble and slate to mimic clouds and waves?

Modern Fine Art vs. Craft

How to transition from simple decorative pebbles to 'High Art'? We explore the works of modern masters who transform stones into hyper-realistic animals or surreal conceptual objects.

Technical Durability

How do you ensure that paint never chips, cracks, or fades? We will master the layering techniques necessary for the stone to be handled freely and remain an 'ultimate' durable art object.

The Philosophy of Form

How can a crack, depression, or the natural contour of a rock become a vital part of your composition? You will learn to 'see' the hidden image within the raw material.

detailsSection.title: Program Content and Technical Mastery
detailsSection.text:
Surface Preparation and Leveling

Finding a perfectly flat stone is rare. You will learn to engineer your own surface by creating specialized primers and grounds. We cover materials that allow you to level uneven surfaces or create a specific texture over the stone, ensuring professional paint adhesion on even the 'slickest' minerals.

Miniature and Multi-Layer Painting

Working on stone often involves miniature painting, requiring extreme patience and precision. You will master the sequential application of layers using various media: Oil, Acrylic, Tempera, or even Watercolor. This process includes detailed sketching and building volume through glazing, similar to classical iconography and academic drawing.

3D Thinking and Problem Solving

The course develops 'volumetric' thinking. Unlike a flat sheet of paper, a stone requires you to account for a 360-degree view and a non-linear surface. This skill is essential for solving complex artistic problems related to irregular shapes and three-dimensional textures.

Artistic and Philosophical Heritage

Mastering stone painting provides a powerful foundation for design and construction. The patience and precision gained here are directly applicable to other irregular objects and modern industries. In the future, students can apply these skills in Architectural Decor (customizing marble or granite interiors), Jewelry Design (miniatures on semi-precious gems), and Game Development‚Äîwhere a deep understanding of geological textures and light interaction is vital for realistic 3D texturing. This course transforms a simple natural element into a sophisticated medium for conceptual and narrative art.

Format and Logistics

The training is conducted as private individual sessions with the teacher traveling to the student's home for maximum comfort and efficiency. You choose your package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons. Note that all necessary materials and equipment are not included in the session cost. Lessons are conducted in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and bordering suburbs of Germany and France.

806.title: Contemporary Painting Course
806.briefDescription: Master the fusion of Old Master discipline and contemporary vision. Learn to create high-level art that balances technical perfection with raw, conceptual power.
806.description:
The Program Focus

Does contemporary art require skill, or is it just ideas? This course proves that the strongest modern artists are masters of tradition. We explore painting as a visceral act of gesture and drama, moving far beyond mechanical copying or simple illustration.

Questions You Will Answer

The Reality of Style

What defines the line between Hyperrealism and Magical Realism? Why does modern painting value 'unfinished' edges and visible drips alongside extreme precision?

Market and Meaning

How do you distinguish 'High Art' from Kitsch? Is your work a commercial product or a museum-level masterpiece?

The Power of Tradition

How do we use history as a toolkit rather than a cage? Why is the mastery of the human form still the ultimate weapon of the contemporary painter?

detailsSection.title: Program Content and Technical Mastery
detailsSection.text:
The Modern Alchemy of Paint

You will master the physical 'event' of painting: from Alla Prima and heavy impasto to the sophisticated secrets of multi-layered Glazing. We focus on 'psychological likeness' rather than just photographic accuracy.

Deconstructing the Masters

Learn to 'hack' the methods of the greats to build your own signature style. We explore how to balance technical perfection with the courage to destroy and reinvent a canvas, losing the fear of the 'spoiled' work in favor of raw expression.

The Technical Base

We cover the essential physics of oil painting: from surface preparation and underpainting to the chemistry of mediums. This course provides the structural foundation required for museum-level exhibitions and professional gallery representation.

Format and Logistics

Private individual sessions conducted at the student's home for maximum efficiency. Choose a package of 1, 5, or 10 lessons. Materials are not included. Lessons are available in Basel, Basel-Landschaft, and neighboring suburbs of Germany and France.

courses.standardDurationText:
Course Duration and Individual Pace

The full curriculum is structured as a comprehensive path of 40 double sessions or 80 academic hours, which includes the student's essential self-work. However, as these are private individual sessions, the total time required to master the material is flexible; it adapts entirely to your personal progress, artistic background, and the time you dedicate to practice. There are no rigid deadlines and no grades; the focus is exclusively on your individual mastery of the craft and the quality of your artistic development.

1.author: Samantha Levitt
1.text: My course with Ilya was great. Ilya was friendly, very knowledgeable, encouraging and totally adaptable to my needs and goals. It was fun to plan long-term projects with him and discuss styles and art history. If you are looking for a teacher who is both experienced, knowledgeable and relaxed, I highly recommend Ilya!

2.author: Alona Rechson
2.text: I met Ilya through the world of visual arts. First and foremost, he‚Äôs an incredible artist, a fascinating and controversial figure, and truly one of the funniest people I‚Äôve ever known! He was also my tattoo artist; he helped me break into the industry, mentored me, and gave me the courage to get started. Today, I am the proud owner of my own tattoo business ‚ù§Ô∏è

3.author: Dr.Devorah Schwartz-Arad
3.text: Lessons with you were an enriching experience, combining rigorous step-by-step learning without compromising on quality, while maintaining a sense of perfection and correct methodology. We started from the basics‚Äîpreparing the canvas, measuring and understanding proportions, and acrylic underpainting‚Äîleading up to the highlight: oil painting. I am currently working on portraits of my family members from photos. You have definitely given me a solid foundation for my work, and I hope the results you see do not disappoint you.

4.author: Dr.Dikla Arad
4.text: I arrived about two years ago with almost zero experience and many fears. I quickly realized I was in the right hands. You are a patient, attentive, and kind teacher, with a rare ability to explain complex principles simply and clearly without pressure. You knew exactly when to guide, when to correct, and when to let me experiment. I especially appreciated your insistence that I do everything myself‚Äîparticularly the difficult corrections‚Äîso that in the end, the painting is entirely 'mine,' giving me a huge sense of pride. This was an empowering experience both artistically and personally. I previously studied with different teachers, but your teaching was honest, enriching, and filled with true faith in art. You ensured we knew other artists and always brought examples from the masters to support your instructions. Thank you for the journey and the belief in me.

section1.title: Introduction
section1.text: The protection of personal data is a primary concern. Data processing is conducted exclusively within the framework of applicable legal requirements, specifically the Swiss Federal Act on Data Protection (FADP) and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

section2.title: Responsible Party
section2.text: Responsibility for data processing lies with the operator of this application. Inquiries regarding data protection may be submitted via the contact form located on the contact page.

section3.title: Intellectual Property and Copyright
section3.text: All images of paintings, drawings, and artistic content are original works by Ilya Medvedev. Unauthorized use, reproduction, distribution, or modification of these images is strictly prohibited under any conditions. All photographs within the application are the exclusive property of the operator.

section4.title: Scope of Data Processing
section4.text: Data processing includes information voluntarily submitted (such as name, email address, physical address, and date of birth) and technical data (IP address, device type) collected automatically for security and optimization purposes.

section5.title: Payments (Stripe & Google Pay)
section5.text: Order processing is managed via Stripe. This includes Credit Cards and Digital Wallets such as Google Pay. No sensitive payment or credit card data is stored on the application servers.

section6.title: Hosting and Data Location
section6.text: The application is hosted via Firebase (Google Cloud). Servers are located in Zurich, Switzerland (region: europe-west6), ensuring that data remains within Swiss jurisdiction.

section7.title: Cookies
section7.text: Strictly necessary session cookies are utilized to enable booking functionality and form submissions. Marketing or third-party tracking cookies are not employed.

section8.title: Data Disclosure
section8.text: Data is disclosed to third parties only when necessary for service fulfillment (e.g., Payroll Plus AG for billing purposes) or when required by legal obligation.

section9.title: Subject Rights
section9.text: Under the FADP, rights exist regarding information, rectification, erasure, and data portability. To exercise these rights, communication should be directed through the contact form.

section10.title: Data Security
section10.text: SSL/TLS encryption is implemented to protect the transmission of confidential content and personal inquiries.

section11.title: Changes
section11.text: The right to update this privacy policy is reserved. The most current version is maintained on this page.

section1.title: Scope of Service
section1.text: Profineart Studio Basel, represented by Ilya Medvedev, provides private art instruction. Services are provided on a freelance basis via Payroll Plus AG.

section2.title: Geographic Limitations
section2.text: Standard service area includes Basel and locations within a 25km radius. Locations outside this radius require prior confirmation.

section3.title: Booking and Scheduling
section3.text: Initial sessions are booked via the online calendar. Subsequent package lessons are scheduled directly with the instructor.

section4.title: Pricing and Payment
section4.text: All prices are in CHF and include travel within the 25km radius. Payment is due at the time of booking.

section5.title: Cancellation Policy
section5.text: Cancellations must be made 48 hours in advance. Late cancellations incur a 50 CHF fee, except in cases of medical emergency.

section6.title: Refund Policy
section6.text: Single lessons are non-refundable. For packages of 5 or 10, a refund of remaining units is possible if the client is dissatisfied after the first lesson.

section7.title: Student Responsibility
section7.text: Progress depends on student engagement and completion of assignments. The instructor is not liable for property damage at the lesson location.

section8.title: Communication
section8.text: Primary communication is via email. Phone contact is provided only after a confirmed booking.

section9.title: Governing Law
section9.text: This agreement is governed by the laws of Switzerland. The place of jurisdiction is Basel.
